thread.title: Award-winning piemaker Lord of the Pies plans to open Chorlton cafe
thread.title_full: Award-winning piemaker Lord of the Pies plans to open Chorlton cafe

author: Emily Heward
title: Award-winning piemaker Lord of the Pies plans to open Chorlton cafe
text:
Lindsay Meckie and Oliver Doyle, of Lord of the Pies Share Get What's On   Thank you for subscribing!   
Award-winning pie-maker Lord of the Pies has its sights set on Chorlton for its next cafe. 
Oliver Doyle, who founded the shop in Stockport in 2011 before launching a second site in Macclesfield, has applied for a licence to open a third at 559a Barlow Moor Road in the south Manchester suburb. 
The business has picked up a string of prizes at the British Pie Awards over the years for bakes including its locally-reared roast beef, mushroom and real ale and pulled chicken balti pies. 
Pies on the current Stockport menu also include confit pork and Bury black pudding, and slow braised Cheshire lamb with red wine jus, along with vegetarian options such as sweet potato, spinach and goat's cheese, with prices from Â£3. 
The proposed Chorlton shop would be open seven days a week, serving pies and drinks from 12 noon until midnight, according to the application, which will go before a licensing committee next month. Read More
